lines.text: The Duke of Athens, soon to be married to Hippolyta, decrees that his subject, Hermia, shall give up her lover, Lysander, and marry Demetrius whom her father has chosen. The lovers decide to elope. They are followed by Demetrius and Helena in love with Demetrius.
Penelope discovers the mischief that has been done. She restores the weaver to his normal shape and happily unites the lovers.
